content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!--Generated by XML Authority. Conforms to w3c http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema--> <!--  From http://feapmo.gov/schema/FEA_XML_Schema_Rev_1.xsd 2002-08-13 --> <xs:schema targetNamespace="www.feapmo.gov" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns="www.feapmo.gov" elementFormDefault="qualified" attributeFormDefault="unqualified">  <xs:element name="FederalEnterpriseArchitecture">   <xs:annotation>    <xs:documentation>FEA is the Federal Enterprise Architecture Business Reference Model. The Business Reference Model will provide OMB and the Agencies with an invaluable tool for improving the business of government from a cross-Agency perspective.</xs:documentation>   </xs:annotation>   <xs:complexType>    <xs:sequence>     <xs:element ref="BusinessAreaDetails"/>     <xs:element ref="BusinessLineDetails"/>     <xs:element ref="SubFunctionDetails"/>    </xs:sequence>   </xs:complexType>   <xs:key name="KeyBusinessAreaByID">    <xs:selector xpath="BusinessAreaDetails/BusinessArea"/>    <xs:field xpath="@businessAreaID"/>   </xs:key>   <xs:key name="KeyBusinessLineByID">    <xs:selector xpath="BusinessLineDetails/BusinessLine"/>    <xs:field xpath="@businessLineID"/>   </xs:key>   <xs:keyref name="RefSubFunctionToBusinessLine" refer="KeyBusinessLineByID">    <xs:selector xpath="SubFunctionDetails/SubFunction"/>    <xs:field xpath="@refBusinessLineID"/>   </xs:keyref>   <xs:keyref name="RefBusinessLineToBusinessArea" refer="KeyBusinessAreaByID">    <xs:selector xpath="BusinessLineDetails/BusinessLine"/>    <xs:field xpath="@refBusinessAreaID"/>   </xs:keyref>   <xs:keyref name="RefSubFunctionToBusinessArea" refer="KeyBusinessAreaByID">    <xs:selector xpath="SubFunctionDetails/SubFunction"/>    <xs:field xpath="@refBusinessAreaID"/>   </xs:keyref>   <!-- make sure to go back and add the proper min and max occurance indicators -->  </xs:element>  <xs:element name="BusinessAreaDetails">   <xs:annotation>    <xs:documentation>Three Business Areas provide a high-level view of the types of operations the Federal Government performs.</xs:documentation>   </xs:annotation>   <xs:complexType>    <xs:sequence>     <xs:element ref="BusinessArea" minOccurs="4" maxOccurs="4"/>    </xs:sequence>   </xs:complexType>   <xs:unique name="businessAreaID">    <xs:selector xpath="BusinessArea"/>    <xs:field xpath="@businessAreaID"/>   </xs:unique>  </xs:element>  <xs:element name="BusinessLineDetails">   <xs:annotation>    <xs:documentation>The three Business Areas decompose into 34 Business Lines (in some cases could be called Internal Functions). These Business Lines describe more specifically the services and products the Government provides to its stakeholders, while the Internal Functions describe the inter and intra Agency back office and suppor activities that enable the Government to operate.</xs:documentation>   </xs:annotation>   <xs:complexType>    <xs:sequence>     <xs:element ref="BusinessLine" minOccurs="38" maxOccurs="38"/>    </xs:sequence>   </xs:complexType>   <xs:unique name="businessLineID">    <xs:selector xpath="BusinessLine"/>    <xs:field xpath="@businessLineID"/>   </xs:unique>  </xs:element>  <xs:element name="SubFunctionDetails">   <xs:annotation>    <xs:documentation>There are 134 SubFunctions which form the final level of decomposition within the Federal Enterprise Architecture Business Reference Model and communicate the specific activities that Federal Agencies perform within wach Line of Business and Internal Function. </xs:documentation>   </xs:annotation>   <xs:complexType>    <xs:sequence>     <xs:element ref="SubFunction" minOccurs="157" maxOccurs="157"/>    </xs:sequence>   </xs:complexType>   <xs:unique name="subFunctionID">    <xs:selector xpath="SubFunction"/>    <xs:field xpath="@subFunctionID"/>   </xs:unique>  </xs:element>  <xs:element name="BusinessArea">   <xs:complexType>    <xs:sequence>     <xs:element name="BusinessAreaName"/>     <xs:element name="BusinessAreaDefinitionText"/>    </xs:sequence>    <xs:attribute name="businessAreaID" type="IntegerFixed5Type" use="required"/>   </xs:complexType>  </xs:element>  <xs:element name="BusinessLine">   <xs:complexType>    <xs:sequence>     <xs:element name="BusinessLineName"/>     <xs:element name="BusinessLineDefinitionText"/>    </xs:sequence>    <xs:attribute name="businessLineID" type="IntegerFixed5Type" use="required"/>    <xs:attribute name="refBusinessAreaID" type="IntegerFixed5Type" use="required"/>   </xs:complexType>  </xs:element>  <xs:element name="SubFunction">   <xs:complexType>    <xs:sequence>     <xs:element name="SubFunctionName"/>     <xs:element name="SubFunctionDefinitionText"/>    </xs:sequence>    <xs:attribute name="subFunctionID" type="IntegerFixed5Type" use="required"/>    <xs:attribute name="refBusinessLineID" type="IntegerFixed5Type" use="required"/>    <xs:attribute name="refBusinessAreaID" type="IntegerFixed5Type" use="required"/>   </xs:complexType>  </xs:element>  <xs:simpleType name="IntegerFixed5Type">   <xs:restriction base="xs:integer">    <xs:pattern value="[0-9]{5}"/>   </xs:restriction>  </xs:simpleType> </xs:schema>
